AvProblem.comment: possible at any time of day

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Moderate danger due to naturally triggered glide-snow, wet-snow avalanches
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is moderate at all altitudes due to glide-snow and wet-snow avalanche problem. In all aspects on steep grass-covered slopes and in forest clearances, glide-snow and wet-snow avalanches can be expected, esp. in afternoon on south-facing slopes, which can in isolated cases place exposed transportation routes at risk. Open glide cracks are indicators of danger, zones near them should be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Very irregular snow distribution. Windblown zones are bare, wind-loaded slopes are filled to the brim. The fresh snow and drifts of recent days have settled and are well bonded with the old snow. The snowpack below 2000 m is nearly isotherm, the ground is often wet. The snowpack is gliding downhill over smooth ground. The snowpack surface is often riddled with water seepage channels, at high altitudes frozen and capable of bearing loads but on sunny slopes softening during daytime hours.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: After a night of partly clear skies, Wednesday will bring lots of sunshine and good. visibility, with some thin clouds. Winds will slacken off noticeably, brisk from the west only on the northern rim of the Alps. Mild: at 2000 m, 0 to +2 degrees, by afternoon rising to +6 to +8 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Also on Thursday, sunny and mild. Danger of glide-snow and wet-snow avalanches will persist.

AvProblem.comment: small wet-snow avalanches, naturally triggered avalanches in afternoon

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Generally low danger but caution urged towards naturally triggered wet-snow, glide-snow avalanches
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is generally low, but pay close heed to small, naturally triggered wet-snow and glide-snow slides esp on south-facing slopes during the course of the day. Danger zones occur on very steep grass-covered slopes, hillsides and in forest clearances. Open glide cracks are indicators of danger, avoid zones below them.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Very irregular snow distribution. Windblown zones are bare, wind-loaded slopes are filled to the brim. The fresh snow and drifts of recent days have settled and are well bonded with the old snow. The snowpack below 2000 m is nearly isotherm, the ground is often wet. The snowpack is gliding downhill over smooth ground.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: After a night of partly clear skies, Wednesday will bring lots of sunshine and good. visibility, with some thin clouds. Winds will slacken off noticeably, brisk from the west only on the northern rim of the Alps. Mild: at 2000 m, 0 to +2 degrees, by afternoon rising to +6 to +8 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Also on Thursday, sunny and mild. Danger of avalanches remains low.
